greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest number such that sigma(a(n)) = n, where sigma is the sum of divisors function (A000203).
comment: Right border of A299762. - _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 14 2018
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: x = 11 is the largest x such that sigma(x) = 12, so a(12) = 11.
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{k = n}, While[k > 0 && DivisorSigma[1, k] != n, k--]; k]; Array[a, 90] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 05 2020 *)
results.author: _Jud McCranie_, Oct 10 2000
